intro: Cleistanthus kasaiensis, commonly known as the Kasai cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central and East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate or elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cleistanthus kasaiensis is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils.
